description:

title: X is officially worth less than half of what Elon Musk paid for it
description:
Everyone knew that Twitter wasn’t worth $44 billion when Elon Musk bought it a year ago. Now, we know what Musk himself thinks it’s worth today: $19 billion.

On Monday, employees at X were awarded equity in the company at a valuation of $19 billion, or $45 per share, according to internal documents seen by The Verge. title: Google once asked Apple to preload its search app on iOS
description:
In late 2018, Google CEO Sundar Pichai floated a bold idea to Apple CEO Tim Cook. Cook had just told Pichai he wanted to be “deep, deep partners, deeply connected where our services end and yours begin,” according to notes from the meeting. Pichai responded with a proposal: What if Apple preinstalled a Google Search app on every iOS device?

description:

title: Biden releases AI executive order directing agencies to develop safety guidelines
description:
President Joe Biden signed an executive order providing rules around generative AI, ahead of any legislation coming from lawmakers.
